conbody.p: The Application Binary Interface, or ABI, is the set of rules that all binaries must follow in order to run on a nanoMIPS system. This includes, for example, object file format, instruction set, data layout, subroutine calling convention, and system call numbers. The ABI is one part of the mechanism that maintains binary compatibility across all nanoMIPS platforms.
p32 improves on o32 to provide an ABI that is efficient in both code density and performance. p32 is required for the nanoMIPS architecture.
